original: lhang nger mi rung ba de lta bu thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lhang nger mi rung ba de lta bu thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “In order to illuminate all those places where it is not light, not bright, not radiant, where it is dark, very dark, pitch black, where the sun and moon, powerful and majestic though they are, cannot make light, cannot make brightness, cannot make radiance, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na mun pa mun nag smag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na mun pa mun nag smag tu gyur pa /
translated: “In order to illuminate all those places in the world systems in the downward direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, where it is dark, very dark, pitch black,

original: smag gis khyab pa /
analyzed: smag gis khyab pa /
translated: where it is pervaded by darkness,

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing /🔽'di ltar gzi brjid che la /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing / 'di ltar gzi brjid che la /
translated: where the sun and moon, powerful and majestic though they are,

original: 'di ltar mthu che ba gnyis kyis kyang lham mer mi rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthu che ba gnyis kyis kyang lham mer mi rung /
translated: cannot make light,

original: lhan ner mi rung /🔽lhang nger mi rung ba de lta bu thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lhan ner mi rung / lhang nger mi rung ba de lta bu thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: cannot make brightness,🔽cannot make radiance, bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po steng gi phyogs kyi @89a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po steng gi phyogs kyi @89a *//
translated: “In order to illuminate all those places in the world systems in the upward direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, where it is dark, very dark, pitch black,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na mun pa mun nag smag tu gyur pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na mun pa mun nag smag tu gyur pa /
translated: In as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, there are places of darkness, deep darkness,

original: smag gis khyab pa /
analyzed: smag gis khyab pa /
translated: pervaded by darkness,

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing /
translated: where even the two, the sun and the moon, who have such great miraculous powers,

original: 'di ltar gzi brjid che la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzi brjid che la /
translated: who have such great splendor,🔽who have such great might, cannot illuminate,

original: 'di ltar mthu che ba gnyis kyis kyang lham mer mi rung /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthu che ba gnyis kyis kyang lham mer mi rung /
translated: cannot make bright,

original: lhan ner mi rung /
analyzed: lhan ner mi rung /
translated: cannot make clear.

original: lhang nger mi rung ba de lta bu thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lhang nger mi rung ba de lta bu thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to illuminate all such places should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed ji snyed pa gang du sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra sems can rnams kyis mi thos pa de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu sems can de dag thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed ji snyed pa gang du sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra sems can rnams kyis mi thos pa de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag tu sems can de dag thams cad kyis sangs rgyas dang /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who wish to cause all beings to hear the words ‘Buddha,’ ‘Dharma,’ and ‘Saṅgha’ in all the worlds in the eastern direction, as many worlds as there are sand particles in the Ganges River, where those words are not heard,

original: chos dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra thos par bya bar 'dod pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba la dgod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //

translated: and who wish to establish them in the correct view, should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra said,🔽“Excellent, excellent, Bhagavān!”

translated: Wherever the sounds of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha are not heard by sentient beings, in such worlds, all those sentient beings will hear the sounds of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha.

translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings who want to make the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha heard by all beings in those world systems where beings do not hear the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha, and who want to establish them in the right view, should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: 'on pa rnams rna bas sgra thos pa dang / smyon pa rnams dran pa thob pa dang / gos med pa rnams gos thob pa dang / bkres pa dang skom pa rnams zas dang skom thob pa dang / nad pa rnams nad 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'on pa rnams rna bas sgra thos pa dang / smyon pa rnams dran pa thob pa dang / gos med pa rnams gos thob pa dang / bkres pa dang skom pa rnams zas dang skom thob pa dang / nad pa rnams nad 'tsho bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: and the deaf hear sounds with their ears, and the insane regain their memory, and the naked obtain clothes, and the hungry and thirsty obtain food and drink, and the sick are cured of their illnesses,

original: btson ra dang / khri mun na 'khod pa rnams bdag gi rdzu 'phrul dang / bdag gis mthus dga' mgur 'dong du yod par bya'o //
analyzed: btson ra dang / khri mun na 'khod pa rnams bdag gi rdzu 'phrul dang / bdag gis mthus dga' mgur 'dong du yod par bya'o //
translated: and those who are in prison or in chains are freed from their bonds through my magical power and my strength, and they are happy and joyful.

original: snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Even if you think like this, you should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar na phyogs bcu kun gyi phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can mi khom pa dang / ngan song du ltung ba sems can dmyal ba pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyogs bcu kun gyi phyogs re re'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can mi khom pa dang / ngan song du ltung ba sems can dmyal ba pa'am /
translated: How is it that in each of the ten directions, in world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, sentient beings who have no opportunity, who have fallen into the lower realms, who are hell beings,

original: byol song gi skye gnas pa'am /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas pa'am /
translated: or who are animals,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bdag gi mthus de nas 'chi 'phos nas mi'i lus thob par bya snyam ste /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bdag gi mthus de nas 'chi 'phos nas mi'i lus thob par bya snyam ste /
translated: I will, by the power of my merit, cause all those who are in the world of the Lord of Death to be reborn as humans.

original: sems can de dag thams cad tshul khrims la dgod par 'dod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dgod par 'dod pa dang / shes rab la dgod par 'dod pa dang / rnam par grol ba la dgod par 'dod pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad tshul khrims la dgod par 'dod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la dgod par 'dod pa dang / shes rab la dgod par 'dod pa dang / rnam par grol ba la dgod par 'dod pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: I will cause all those sentient beings to be established in morality, in meditative stabilization, in wisdom, in liberation, and in the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: I will cause them to be established in the fruit of entering the stream, in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, in arhatship,

original: rang byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la dgod par @94a *//
analyzed: rang byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la dgod par @94a *//
translated: in individual enlightenment, in the knowledge of path aspects,

original: 'dod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to establish all beings in the ten wholesome actions, in the four concentrations, in the four formless absorptions, in the four forbearing acceptances, in the five clairvoyances, in the five powers, in the seven limbs of awakening, in the eightfold noble path, in the fruit of the stream-winner, in the fruit of the once-returner, in the fruit of the non-returner, in the fruit of the worthy one, in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam la bslab par 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / tshul rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'phrin las dang / gsung gi 'phrin las dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam la bslab par 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / tshul rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'phrin las dang / gsung gi 'phrin las dang /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wants to train in the Tathāgata’s conduct, in the Tathāgata’s way of life, in the purity of the Tathāgata’s body, speech, and mind karma,

original: thugs kyi 'phrin las ye shes sngon du 'gro ba yongs su dag pa la bslab par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi 'phrin las ye shes sngon du 'gro ba yongs su dag pa la bslab par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: in the Tathāgata’s pure karma that is preceded by knowledge, should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste / ji ltar na /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they should investigate as follows:

original: bdag gis glang po chen po'i lta stangs kyis bltas te sems can rnams la thogs pa med par chos bstan par 'gyur /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bdag gis glang po chen po'i lta stangs kyis bltas te sems can rnams la thogs pa med par chos bstan par 'gyur / ji ltar na /
translated: “How can I, with the gaze of a great elephant, teach the Dharma to sentient beings without impediment?

original: sengge chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pas rnam par bsgying bar 'gyur /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: sengge chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pas rnam par bsgying bar 'gyur / ji ltar na /
translated: How can I, with the majestic posture of a great lion, display the majestic posture?

original: bdag gis don yod pa'i rnam par mnan pas rnam par mnan par bya /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bdag gis don yod pa'i rnam par mnan pas rnam par mnan par bya / ji ltar na /
translated: How can I, with the trampling of the fearless one, trample?

original: bdag sa chen po la sor bzhi tsam gyis rkang pas mi reg par 'gro bar 'gyur /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bdag sa chen po la sor bzhi tsam gyis rkang pas mi reg par 'gro bar 'gyur / ji ltar na /
translated: How can I, without touching the great earth with my feet for four steps, walk?

original: bdag gis padmo lo ma stong dang ldan pa la rkang pa gnyis kyi mthil bzhag cing rkang pa'i 'og na gnas pa'i srog chags @94b rnams la mi gnod par 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: bdag gis padmo lo ma stong dang ldan pa la rkang pa gnyis kyi mthil bzhag cing rkang pa'i 'og na gnas pa'i srog chags @94b rnams la mi gnod par 'gro bar bya /
translated: How can I, placing the soles of my two feet on a thousand-petaled lotus, walk without harming the creatures that dwell under my feet?

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: How can I, with the gait of a great elephant, walk?

original: bdag rkang pa'i mthil 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa gnyis kyi sa chen po la rnam par bris te 'gro bar 'gyur /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bdag rkang pa'i mthil 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa gnyis kyi sa chen po la rnam par bris te 'gro bar 'gyur / ji ltar na /
translated: May I walk on the great earth, drawing patterns with the two thousand spokes of the wheels on the soles of my feet.🔽“How can I walk on the great earth, covering the entire surface with the soles of my feet?

original: bdag sa chen po la 'khor kun tu 'khor lo tsam gyi khyon yongs su bskor cing 'chag sa na 'chag par 'gyur /🔽ji ltar na /🔽bdag sa chen po thams cad du rgyu zhing song yang sa'i rdul gyis mi gos par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag sa chen po la 'khor kun tu 'khor lo tsam gyi khyon yongs su bskor cing 'chag sa na 'chag par 'gyur / ji ltar na / bdag sa chen po thams cad du rgyu zhing song yang sa'i rdul gyis mi gos par 'gyur /
translated: “How can I walk on the great earth, covering the entire surface with the soles of my feet?🔽“How can I walk on the great earth, covering the entire surface with the soles of my feet?

analyzed: ji ltar na; bdag dpag tshad gcig gam / gnyis sam / gsum mam / bzhi'am / lnga'am / bcu'am / nyi shu'am /

analyzed: dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig gam /

analyzed: dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig brgya'am / dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig stong ngam /

analyzed: dpag tshad bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong nas dpag tshad tshad med pa'am /

analyzed: grangs med pa'am / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'am / mtshungs pa med pa'am / mtha' yas pa'am / kun tu mtha' yas pa'am /

analyzed: gzhal du med pa'am /

analyzed: bdag gis rkang pa'i mthil 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa gnyis nas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong bkye ste mi khom pa dang / ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byas nas sems can thams cad bde bar bya bar 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “Even if I were to think, ‘I will emit a hundred thousand times ten million trillion light rays from the two soles of my feet, and having pacified all the sufferings of the unfortunate realms and the inopportune births, I will bring happiness to all sentient beings,’ still I should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

translated: furthermore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they should investigate as follows:

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: “How is it that

translated: I am the king of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the Trāyastriṃśa realm, the Yāma realm, the Tuṣita realm, the Nirmāṇa­rata realm, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm, the Brahmakāyika realm, the Brahmapurohita realm, the Brahmapārṣadya realm,

analyzed: tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang /
translated: the Mahābrahmā realm, the Ābhāsvara realm, the Parīttābha realm, the Apramāṇābha realm, the Ābhāsvara realm, the Śubhakṛtsna realm, the Parīttaśubha realm, the Apramāṇaśubha realm, the Śubhakṛtsna realm, the Bṛhatphala realm, the Apramāṇaśubha realm, and the Śubhakṛtsna realm.

translated: and the gods of the Brahma-world, the gods of the Great Brahma-world, the gods of Limited Radiance, the gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the gods of Lustrous Radiance, the gods of Limited Splendor, the gods of Immeasurable Splendor, the gods of Luminous Splendor, the gods of the Cloudless realm, the gods of Merit Transference, the gods of Great Fruition, the gods of No-thought, the gods of Limited Mindfulness, the gods of Immeasurable Mindfulness, the gods of Flawless Mindfulness, the gods of Limited Good Vision, the gods of Immeasurable Good Vision, the gods of Excellent Vision, the gods of No Heat, the gods of No Oppression, the gods of Good Appearance, the gods of Excellent Appearance, the gods of Highest Form, and the gods of Ultimate Form, and so on, up to the gods of Akaniṣṭha, in their many trillions, surrounding him and leading the way, I will go to the seat of awakening.

translated: When I am sitting at the foot of the Bodhi tree, may the gods of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods,🔽the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods,

translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods, and the Śubhakṛtsna gods,

translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste / ji ltar na /
translated: great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom should investigate this matter as follows:

original: bdag snying po byang chub la 'dug ste /🔽mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'i lag gis sa chen po la brdabs nas nag po'i @96a *//
analyzed: bdag snying po byang chub la 'dug ste / mtshan gyis legs par brgyan pa'i lag gis sa chen po la brdabs nas nag po'i @96a *//
translated: ‘How can I, seated at the heart of enlightenment,

original: phyogs bdud 'khor dang bcas pa shin tu pham par bya snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bdud 'khor dang bcas pa shin tu pham par bya snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: with hands adorned with the major marks of a superior being, strike the great earth and utterly defeat the dark forces of the māras and their retinues?’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste / ji ltar na /
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he should investigate as follows:🔽“How can I, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, cause the ground to become the nature of vajra, wherever beings go, stand, sit, or lie down?”

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'i sa phyogs de dag rdo rje'i rang bzhin du 'dug par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba'i sa phyogs de dag rdo rje'i rang bzhin du 'dug par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o // sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: He should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, they should investigate as follows:

original: ji ltar na; bdag nyi ma gang la mngon par byung ba de nyid kyi nyi ma la nag po'i phyogs 'khor dang bcas pa pham par byas te bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar na; bdag nyi ma gang la mngon par byung ba de nyid kyi nyi ma la nag po'i phyogs 'khor dang bcas pa pham par byas te bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya /
translated: “On the very day that I go forth, may I defeat the forces of the dark side and awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: mngon par sangs rgyas nas ni /
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas nas ni /
translated: Having awakened,

original: ji ltar nyi ma de nyid la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma de nyid la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya /
translated: may I turn the wheel of Dharma on that very day.

original: 'khor lo bskor nas ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo bskor nas ni /
translated: Having turned the wheel of Dharma,

original: ji ltar tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams rdul dang bral te dri ma dang bral nas chos la chos kyi mig rnam par dag par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams rdul dang bral te dri ma dang bral nas chos la chos kyi mig rnam par dag par bya /
translated: may countless, innumerable beings become free from dust and free from stains, and may the eye of the Dharma become pure for them.

original: tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams ni /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams ni /
translated: May countless, innumerable beings

original: ji ltar nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems @96b rnam par grol bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems @96b rnam par grol bar bya /
translated: become free from grasping and liberated from the defilements.

original: tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams ni /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med pa'i sems can rnams ni /
translated: May countless, innumerable beings

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par bya snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par bya snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: If you think, ‘How should I avoid turning back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?’ you should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they should arouse their thoughts in this way:

original: ji ltar na /🔽bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na / bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni /
translated: ‘How should I,🔽when I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: tshad med grangs med par 'gyur /🔽chos bstan pa gcig gis stan gcig pa'i dgra bcom pa ni /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med par 'gyur / chos bstan pa gcig gis stan gcig pa'i dgra bcom pa ni /
translated: have an immeasurable, countless saṅgha of śrāvakas?

original: tshad med grangs med par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med par 'gyur /
translated: How should I, with a single teaching of the Dharma, have an immeasurable, countless number of worthy ones on a single seat?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: How should I have bodhisattva great beings

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur /
translated: who do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun ni /
translated: The Sangha of Bodhisattvas is🔽

original: tshad med grangs med par 'gyur /🔽tshe'i tshad ni /
analyzed: tshad med grangs med par 'gyur / tshe'i tshad ni /
translated: the bodhisattva saṅgha will be immeasurable and countless,

original: dpag tu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: dpag tu med par 'gyur /
translated: the lifespan will be immeasurable,

original: 'od dpag tu med pa ni /🔽phun sum tshogs par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa ni / phun sum tshogs par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and the light will be immeasurable.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
translated: if you think that the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom in order to have such thoughts as these:

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: ‘How can I,

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing der 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sgra'ang mi grag par bya @97a *//🔽snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing der 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sgra'ang mi grag par bya @97a *// snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: when I have attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, in that buddhafield make the sounds of desire, anger, and ignorance unheard?’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,🔽if you think that the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the perfection of wisdom in order to have such thoughts as these:

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they should give rise to the following thought:

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: ‘How can I,

original: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad 'di ltar sbyin pa ni /🔽dge ba'o // dul ba ni /🔽dge ba'o // sdom pa ni /
analyzed: bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing de'i sems can thams cad 'di ltar sbyin pa ni / dge ba'o // dul ba ni / dge ba'o // sdom pa ni /
translated: when I have attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, ensure that all the sentient beings in that buddhafield will possess the wisdom that knows that generosity is virtuous,🔽that self-control is virtuous,🔽that restraint is virtuous,

original: dge ba'o // tshangs par spyod pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'o // tshangs par spyod pa ni /
translated: that pure conduct is virtuous,

original: dge ba'o // srog chags su gyur pa thams cad la 'tshe ba med pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'o // srog chags su gyur pa thams cad la 'tshe ba med pa ni /
translated: and that non-violence toward all living beings is virtuous?’

original: dge ba'o // zhes bya bar shes pa'i shes rab de lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'o // zhes bya bar shes pa'i shes rab de lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: In this way, they should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste / ji ltar na /
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he should generate the following thought:

original: bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang dam pa'i chos nub ces bya ba'i sgra'ang mi grag par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang dam pa'i chos nub ces bya ba'i sgra'ang mi grag par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: “How can I, even after attaining complete nirvāṇa, make sure that the sound of the words ‘the sublime Dharma is disappearing’ is never heard?”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ltar yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he should investigate as follows:

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: “How can I,

original: bdag gi ming thos pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can mang po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @97b pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par
analyzed: bdag gi ming thos pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can mang po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @97b pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur snyam na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par
translated: “Even if I were to think, ‘By merely hearing my name, may many beings in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River be set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,’ I should train in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bya'o // sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽gang gi tshe de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing yon tan 'di dag sgrub par gyur pa de'i tshe rgyal po chen po bzhi'ang gang sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sngon gyi rgyal
analyzed: bya'o // sh'a radva ti'i bu / gang gi tshe de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing yon tan 'di dag sgrub par gyur pa de'i tshe rgyal po chen po bzhi'ang gang sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la sngon gyi rgyal
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: po chen po rnams kyis phul ba'i lhung bzed rnams bdag cag gis kyang 'di la dbul bar bya'o //🔽zhes dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po chen po rnams kyis phul ba'i lhung bzed rnams bdag cag gis kyang 'di la dbul bar bya'o // zhes dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom accomplish these qualities, at that time the four great kings will also be delighted, thinking, “The alms bowls that were previously offered to the thus-gone ones by the great kings of the past, we too should offer to this one.”

original: bdag cag gis 'di la rim gro dang / phu dud du bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di la rim gro dang / phu dud du bya'o //
translated: They will think, “We should serve and venerate this one.”

original: zhes sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three rejoice.

original: mtshe ma'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshe ma'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro // dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro // 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of Yāma rejoice.🔽The gods of Tuṣita rejoice.🔽The gods of the Heaven of Delight in Emanations rejoice.

original: gzhal 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar lha ma yin gyi ris rnams ni /
analyzed: gzhal 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro // de ltar lha ma yin gyi ris rnams ni /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Masters of Others’ Emanations rejoice.

original: 'grib par 'gyur /🔽lha'i ris rnams ni /
analyzed: 'grib par 'gyur / lha'i ris rnams ni /
translated: In this way, the ranks of the asuras will decline,

original: 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the ranks of the gods will increase.

original: 'di mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du bdag cag gis gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i don du bdag cag gis gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: When he has fully awakened, we will request him to turn the wheel of Dharma.’

original: zhes tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the class of the Brahmakāyika rejoice.🔽The gods of the class of the Ābhāsvara rejoice.

original: kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro; ;dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro; ;dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the class of the Śubhakṛtsna rejoice.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the class of the Bṛhatphala rejoice.

original: mi che ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi che ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Mahêśvara class will rejoice.🔽The gods of the Parī­ttābha class will rejoice.

original: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyang @98a *//🔽dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyang @98a *// dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Apramāṇābha class will rejoice.🔽The gods of the Ābhāsvara class will rejoice.

original: shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro // gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Śubhakṛtsna class will rejoice.🔽The gods of the Bṛhatphala class will rejoice.🔽The gods of the Avṛha class will rejoice.🔽The gods of the Atapa class will rejoice.🔽The gods of the Sudarśana class will rejoice.

original: 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Akaniṣṭha class will rejoice.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom🔽and develop the six transcendent perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyang bdag cag ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyang bdag cag ni /
translated: the sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas will think,

original: sems can chen po 'di'i pha dang / ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes dang / grogs po dang / bshes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can chen po 'di'i pha dang / ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes dang / grogs po dang / bshes par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be my father, mother, brother, sister, wife, son, daughter, friend, minister, relative, companion, and intimate.

original: snyam ste dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la btsun mo'i 'khor dbul lo zhes rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / mtshe ma'i lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang /
analyzed: snyam ste dga' bar 'gyur ro // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la btsun mo'i 'khor dbul lo zhes rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha dang / mtshe ma'i lha dang / dga' ldan gyi lha dang /
translated: ’ He will be happy with this thought.🔽“The four great kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods,

original: 'phrul dga'i lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha dang / tshangs ris kyi lha dang / tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha dang / tshangs chen gyi lha dang / snang ba'i lha dang / chung snang gi lha dang /
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha dang / tshangs ris kyi lha dang / tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha dang / tshangs chen gyi lha dang / snang ba'i lha dang / chung snang gi lha dang /
translated: the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttābha gods,

original: tshad med snang ba'i lha dang / kun snang dang ba'i lha dang / dge ba'i lha dang / chung dge'i lha dang / tshad med dge ba'i lha dang / dge rgyas @98b kyi lha dang / che ba'i lha dang / chung che'i lha dang / tshad med che ba'i lha dang /
analyzed: tshad med snang ba'i lha dang / kun snang dang ba'i lha dang / dge ba'i lha dang / chung dge'i lha dang / tshad med dge ba'i lha dang / dge rgyas @98b kyi lha dang / che ba'i lha dang / chung che'i lha dang / tshad med che ba'i lha dang /
translated: the gods of immeasurable radiance, the gods of abundant radiance, the gods of virtue, the gods of lesser virtue, the gods of immeasurable virtue, the gods of abundant virtue, the gods of greatness, the gods of lesser greatness, the gods of immeasurable greatness,🔽

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha dang / mi che ba'i lha dang / mi gdung ba'i lha dang / shin tu mthong ba'i lha dang / gya nom snang ba'i lha dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha dang / mi che ba'i lha dang / mi gdung ba'i lha dang / shin tu mthong ba'i lha dang / gya nom snang ba'i lha dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: the gods of Boundless Radiance, the gods of Luminous Radiance, the gods of Great Fruit, the gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the gods of Limited Radiance, the gods of Immeasurable Radiance, the gods of Great Fruit, the gods of Immeasurable Virtue, the gods of Limited Virtue, the gods of Immeasurable Virtue, the gods of Great Reward, the gods of No Hardship, the gods of Excellent Vision, the gods of Manifest Joy, and the gods of the Highest Heaven will rejoice.

original: de ni / sems can rnams byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni / sems can rnams byang chub la dgod pa'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa yin te /
translated: They will practice celibacy in order to establish beings in awakening.

original: 'du ba'i chos rnams kyis yongs su 'du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba'i chos rnams kyis yongs su 'du ba ma yin no //
translated: They will not be attracted to things that attract crowds.

original: de 'di ltar smon te /
analyzed: de 'di ltar smon te /
translated: They will make this aspiration:

original: bdag gis sems dang po bskyed nas tshangs par spyad de tshangs par mi spyod pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems dang po bskyed nas tshangs par spyad de tshangs par mi spyod pa med par bya'o //
translated: ‘From the time I first begin to set my mind on awakening, I will practice celibacy and not engage in sexual activity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'dod pa la brten pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa la brten pa ni /

analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba la'ang bar du gcod na /
translated: create obstacles even to being born in the world of Brahmā,

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lta ci smos /
translated: let alone to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /

original: mngon par byung nas tshangs par spyad de /
analyzed: mngon par byung nas tshangs par spyad de /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'i /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'i /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: tshangs par mi spyod par mi bya'o ////
analyzed: tshangs par mi spyod par mi bya'o ////

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Is it the case, Lord,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la pha dang / ma dang / mchis brang dang / bu dang / bu mo gdon mi 'tshal bar 'tshal lam / bcom ldan @99a *//

analyzed: 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: la la la ni /
translated: Some definitely need

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /

analyzed: sems dang po bskyed phyin chad tshangs pa'i spyod pa yang dag par len te /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la ni /

analyzed: thabs mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la yongs su spyad de chung ma'i 'khor gyi nang nas mngon par byung nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: through skillful means, in order to ripen beings, enjoy the five sensory pleasures, and then, having gone forth from the midst of their retinue of wives, they attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la rnam par spyod pa /

original: 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la la ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la la ni /
translated: some of whom are free from the afflictions of desire,

analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan la yongs su spyod pa'ang ston te; nyams kyis yongs su spyod pa med do //

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i mchan bu mkhas pa /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i sngags dang / @99b sbyor thabs kyi tshul la shin tu bslab pa de lta bu zhig gis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga mngon par sprul te /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de dag la bdag nyid rtse zhing dga' ba dang / yongs su spyod par bstan na /

analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: what do you think of this? Would that magician or magician’s apprentice enjoy the five sense pleasures?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

analyzed: de lta bu ma mchis so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings who are well trained in the illusion of the Great Vehicle, who have attained the practice of the illusion-like nature of reality,

translated: Even though they are free from all afflictions, through the power of great compassion they manifest the enjoyment of the five sense objects in order to ripen sentient beings to be trained.🔽They do not associate with them,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'dod pa yongs su shes kyang sems can thabs mkhas pa ma yin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'dod pa yongs su shes kyang sems can thabs mkhas pa ma yin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga las skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang bral ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar ston te /
translated: in this way, although bodhisattva great beings know desires, in order to ripen beings who are not skilled in means, they demonstrate the five desirable qualities in order to make them weary of the five desirable qualities and to separate them from the five desirable qualities.

original: de dag gis myos par 'gyur ba'ang med /
analyzed: de dag gis myos par 'gyur ba'ang med /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang / 'dod pa'i gzhis sdig to'i las byed par 'gyur ba'ang med do //

translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Śāriputra said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: do not see the name ‘bodhisattva,’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'ang yang dag par @100b rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'ang yang dag par @100b rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: do not see bodhisattva practice,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: and do not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the name ‘perfection of wisdom’ as real.

original: spyod ces bya bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the name ‘practice’ as real.

original: mi spyod ces bya bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the name ‘non-practice’ as real.

original: gzugs kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider form as real.

original: tshor ba'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;'du shes kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;'du shes kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as real.

original: 'du byed kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the perfection of giving as real.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom as real.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyis stong /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyis stong /
translated: it is because a bodhisattva is empty of the intrinsic nature of a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang byang chub sems dpa'i ming gis stong ngo //
translated: and the name ‘bodhisattva’ is empty of the intrinsic nature of the name ‘bodhisattva.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin te /
translated: That is its nature.

original: de ni / 'di ltar /🔽stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar / stong pa nyid kyis gzugs stong pa ma yin /
translated: It is like this:🔽Form is not empty because of emptiness.

original: gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de /🔽gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs las gud na'ang stong pa nyid med de / gzugs nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is not other than form.🔽Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //🔽stong pa nyid kyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so // stong pa nyid kyis tshor ba stong pa ma yin /

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su brtags na dmigs su med do //🔽'di lta ste /🔽dper na / rnam par shes pa po rnam par shes pa po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su brtags na dmigs su med do // 'di lta ste / dper na / rnam par shes pa po rnam par shes pa po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you examine this thoroughly, you will not find it.🔽“The one who knows” is a conventional expression.🔽If you examine this thoroughly, you will not find it.

original: tha snyad du brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: tha snyad du brjod mod kyi /
translated: For example, “the one who is conscious” is a conventional expression.🔽If you examine this thoroughly, you will not find it.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su brtags na mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su brtags na mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dmigs su med do //
translated: Because it is emptiness that is not found.

original: ming dang brda tsam du 'ol spyir tha snyad du brjod do //
analyzed: ming dang brda tsam du 'ol spyir tha snyad du brjod do //
translated: It is a conventional expression that is used as a mere conventional term.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, when the bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not see a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see awakening.

original: sangs rgyas @103b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @103b yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see ‘I am practicing the perfection of wisdom.’ He does not see form.

original: tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see feeling.

original: 'du shes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see perception.

original: 'du byed yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see consciousness.

original: ming gang gis tha snyad du brjod pa'i ming de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: ming gang gis tha snyad du brjod pa'i ming de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see the name by which it is conventionally expressed.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par de ma yin pa'i shes rab nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi shes rab kyi bar du dmigs su med pa'i stong pa nyid nye bar bzung bas zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ma gtogs par de ma yin pa'i shes rab nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi shes rab kyi bar du dmigs su med pa'i stong pa nyid nye bar bzung bas zil gyis gnon to //
translated: surpasses the wisdom of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, up to the wisdom of all beings, by apprehending emptiness that is not an object.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //

original: snyam du sems sam /
analyzed: snyam du sems sam /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas te /

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can tshad med grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can tshad med grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o //
translated: having perfected the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, I will deliver countless, immeasurable numbers of sentient beings from saṃsāra.’

original: snyam du sems so //
analyzed: snyam du sems so //
translated: They do not think like that.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dper na / srog chags kyi rigs me khyer ni /

original: 'di ltar / bdag gi snang bas 'dzam bu'i gling kun tu snang bar bya'o; ;bdag gi 'od kyis dzam bu'i gling rgyas par gang bar bya'o //🔽snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag gi snang bas 'dzam bu'i gling kun tu snang bar bya'o; ;bdag gi 'od kyis dzam bu'i gling rgyas par gang bar bya'o // snyam du mi sems so //
translated: I will fill the world with my light!’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'di ltar /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'di ltar /
translated: in the same way, all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas think,

original: bdag cag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad de sems can yongs su smin par byas la /
analyzed: bdag cag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad de sems can yongs su smin par byas la /
translated: ‘We will practice the six perfections, bring sentient beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas te de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par @111a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas te de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par @111a *//
translated: purify a buddhafield, and perfect the ten powers of a tathāgata.

original: byas la / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig ba bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can tshad med grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: byas la / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig ba bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can tshad med grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Having completed the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and lead to nirvana countless, innumerable sentient beings.

original: snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: snyam du mi sems so //
translated: They do not think like that.🔽

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:
