analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba ni / 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad snang bas rgyas par byed do //
translated: when the orb of the sun rises,🔽it fills the entire world with light.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad snang pas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad snang pas gsal bar byed do //
translated: It illuminates the entire world.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'ang sems can yongs su smin par byas shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'ang sems can yongs su smin par byas shing /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the six perfections, having brought beings to maturity

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas te mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par byas te mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: and purified a buddhafield, having perfected the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs bar sangs rgyas nas sems can tshad med grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs bar sangs rgyas nas sems can tshad med grangs med pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla'o //
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, will liberate countless, innumerable sentient beings from cyclic existence.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus @111b bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus @111b bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Śāradvatī­putra then asked him,🔽“Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, having stood in the perfection of wisdom, purify a buddhafield?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das shing /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das shing /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings transcend the levels of the hearers and solitary buddhas,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba lags /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'thob pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyong ba lags /
translated: and how do they attain the irreversible bodhisattva levels and purify the bodhisattva path?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nye bar bzung nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos la gnas te nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'thob bo;; sh'a radva ti'i bus gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nye bar bzung nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos la gnas te nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das nas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'thob bo;; sh'a radva ti'i bus gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: From the time of generating the first thought of enlightenment, when they practice the six perfections, they abide in the dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and having transcended the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, they attain the irreversible bodhisattva levels.🔽Śāradvatīputra said:🔽Blessed One,🔽

original: gang la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽thog ma sems bskyed phyin chad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: gang la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽thog ma sems bskyed phyin chad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni /
translated: From the time of their first production of the thought of enlightenment, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, practicing the six perfections, standing in the dharmas of emptiness, the signless, and the wishless, surpass the Sravakas and the Pratyekabuddhas and reach the irreversible Bodhisattva-stage.

original: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: snying po byang chub la 'dug gi bar du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: until they sit at the site of awakening, they are worthy of gifts to all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni / sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽byang chub @112a *//
analyzed: de ni / sh'a radva ti'i bu / byang chub @112a *//
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod pas /
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yod pas /
translated: it is because of the bodhisattva great beings

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: that all wholesome dharmas appear in the world.

original: 'di ltar / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the paths of the ten wholesome actions appear in the world.

original: bslab pa lnga rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bslab pa lnga rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five trainings appear in the world.

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽bsam gtan bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽tshad med pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // bsam gtan bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // tshad med pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The poṣadha with its eight components appears in the world.🔽The four concentrations appear in the world.🔽The four immeasurables appear in the world.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The four formless absorptions appear in the world.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the five superknowledges will appear in the world;

original: rjes su dran pa drug 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the six superknowledges will appear in the world;

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the perfection of generosity will appear in the world;

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the perfection of conduct will appear in the world;🔽the perfection of patience will appear in the world;

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro /
translated: the perfection of diligence will appear in the world;

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the perfection of meditation will appear in the world;

original: shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽phyi stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pa rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // phyi stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the perfection of wisdom will appear in the world;🔽inner emptiness will appear in the world;🔽outer emptiness will appear in the world;

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: inner and outer emptiness will appear in the world;

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of emptiness will appear in the world,

original: chen po stong pa nyid @112b 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid @112b 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of great extent will appear in the world,

original: don dam pa stong ba nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam pa stong ba nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // 'dus byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of ultimate reality will appear in the world,🔽the emptiness of conditioned phenomena will appear in the world,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena will appear in the world,🔽the emptiness of the unlimited will appear in the world,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end will appear in the world,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of non-discarded will appear in the world,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of inherent existence will appear in the world,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the emptiness of all phenomena will appear in the world.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of defining characteristics will appear in the world;🔽the emptiness of non-apprehension will appear in the world;

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of non-entities will appear in the world;🔽the emptiness of essential nature will appear in the world;

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong ba nyid 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness of essential nature of non-entities will appear in the world;

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the four applications of mindfulness will appear in the world;

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the four right efforts will appear in the world;

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽dbang po lnga 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // dbang po lnga 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the four legs of magical power will appear in the world;🔽the five faculties will appear in the world;

original: stobs lnga 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs lnga 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the five powers will appear in the world;

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the seven parts of awakening will appear in the world;

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the noble eightfold path will appear in the world;

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the four noble truths will appear in the world;

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur @113a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur @113a *//
translated: the eight deliverances will appear in the world;

original: ro // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the nine serial steps of meditative absorption will appear in the world;

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation will appear in the world;

original: mngon par shes pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the forms of higher knowing will appear in the world;

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all the meditative stabilities will appear in the world;

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways will appear in the world;

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas will appear in the world;

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the four forms of fearlessness will appear in the world;

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽byams pa chen po 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // byams pa chen po 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the four right discriminations will appear in the world.🔽great love will appear in the world.

original: snying rje chen po 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: great compassion will appear in the world.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha will appear in the world.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge ba'i chos de dag la sogs ba mang po 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag la sogs ba mang po 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te //
translated: many such good qualities will appear in the world.

original: dge ba'i chos 'di dag 'jig rten du 'byung bas rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba dag yod pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'di dag 'jig rten du 'byung bas rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba dag yod pa yin /
translated: Because these good qualities appear in the world, there are great and high-ranking kṣatriyas,

original: bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho ba dag yod pa yin /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho ba dag yod pa yin /
translated: great and high-ranking brahmins,

original: khyim bdag gi rigs che zhing mtho ba dag yod pa yin /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rigs che zhing mtho ba dag yod pa yin /
translated: great and high-ranking householders,

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the Trāyastriṃśa gods,

original: mtshe ma'i lha rnams yod ba yin /
analyzed: mtshe ma'i lha rnams yod ba yin /
translated: the Yāma gods,

original: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of Tuṣita exist,

original: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations exist,

original: @113b gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽tshangs ris kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: @113b gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams yod pa yin / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations exist,🔽the gods of the Brahmā group exist,

original: tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: tshangs lha nye phan gyi lha rnams yod pa yin / tshangs pa kun 'khor gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the group of the retinue of Brahmā exist,

original: tshangs chen gyi lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽snang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽chung snang gi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: tshangs chen gyi lha rnams yod pa yin / snang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin / chung snang gi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the great total immersion of Brahmā exist,🔽the gods of the Brahmā realm of limited radiance exist,

original: tshad med snang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: tshad med snang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin / kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the Brahmā realm of limitless radiance exist,🔽the gods of the Brahmā realm of shining radiance exist,

original: dge ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the Brahmā realm of abundant virtue exist,

original: chung dge'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: chung dge'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the lesser virtue exist,

original: tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: tshad med dge ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the limitless virtue exist,

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams yod pa yin / che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the abundant virtue exist,🔽the gods of the lesser greatness exist,

original: chung che'i lta rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: chung che'i lta rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the lesser limitlessness exist,

original: tshad med che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: tshad med che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: the gods of the limitless greatness exist,

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽mi che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin / mi che ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Mahābrahma exist.🔽The gods of Parīttābha exist.🔽The gods of Apramāṇābha exist.🔽The gods of Ābhāsvara exist.🔽The gods of Parīttaśubha exist.🔽The gods of Apramāṇaśubha exist.

original: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽shin tu mthong pa'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: mi gdung ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin / shin tu mthong pa'i lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Śubhakṛtsna exist.🔽The gods of Bṛhatphala exist.🔽The gods of Avṛha exist.🔽The gods of Atapa exist.

original: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin /🔽'og min gyi rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams yod pa yin / 'og min gyi rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Sudarśana exist.🔽The gods of Akaniṣṭha exist.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Ākāśānantyāyatana exist.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Vijñānānantyāyatana exist.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Ākiñcanyāyatana exist.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams yod pa yin /
translated: The gods of Naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatana exist.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin /
translated: Those who have entered the stream exist in the world.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams yod pa yin /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams yod pa yin / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams yod pa yin /
translated: Those who are once-returners exist.🔽Those who are non-returners exist.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams yod pa yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams yod pa yin /
translated: Arhats exist.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams yod ba @114a *//
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams yod ba @114a *//
translated: Pratyekabuddhas exist.

original: yin / byang chub sems dpa' rnams yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yin / byang chub sems dpa' rnams yod pa yin te /
translated: “Yes, they do, Subhūti.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'jig rten na yod pa yin no //
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas exist in the world.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de lta lags na /
analyzed: de lta lags na /
translated: if that is so,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sbyin ba yongs su sbyong ba lags sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams sbyin ba yongs su sbyong ba lags sam /
translated: are bodhisattva great beings purified by generosity?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: sbyin pa rnam grangs kyis yongs su sbyong ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam grangs kyis yongs su sbyong ste /
translated: are purified by generosity in terms of its categories.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la ni /
translated: For bodhisattva great beings,

original: sbyin pa kun kyang shin tu dag pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa kun kyang shin tu dag pa ste /
translated: all generosity is completely pure.

original: de'ang 'di ltar /
analyzed: de'ang 'di ltar /
translated: And that is as follows:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni / sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba ste /
translated: bodhisattva great beings🔽give gifts.

original: ci'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhe na /
translated: What do they give?

original: dge ba'i chos du ma'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos du ma'i sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
translated: He gives away the many virtuous dharmas.

original: 'di ltar / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / bslab pa'i gnas lnga dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / bslab pa'i gnas lnga dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i gso sbyong dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: Thus, the paths of the ten virtues, the five precepts, the purification of vows with the eight branches, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the five superknowledges, the six recollections, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @114b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang /🔽don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong ba nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @114b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong ba nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness,🔽ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, emptiness of the unlimited, emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, emptiness of non-dispersal,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of non-entities, and emptiness of essential nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag ba bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: the emptiness that is the nonexistence of things, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of manifestation, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment,

original: smon pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: the noble eightfold path, the four noble truths, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors of liberation, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī doors, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love,

original: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo //🔽gsol pa / bcom @115a *//
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo // gsol pa / bcom @115a *//
translated: He gives the gift of the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the five clairvoyances, the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural powers, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the three gateways to liberation, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the great compassion.

original: ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyis na brtson zhes bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bgyis na brtson zhes bgyi ba lags /
translated: Śāriputra then said, “Lord, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, how are they practicing?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽tshor ba stong pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // tshor ba stong pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the emptiness of form, they are practicing.🔽When they practice the emptiness of feeling, they are practicing.

original: 'du shes stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: When they practice the emptiness of perception, they are practicing.

original: 'du byed stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: When they practice the emptiness of volitional factors, they are practicing.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: When they practice the emptiness of consciousness, they are practicing.

original: mig stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽rna ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽sna stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // rna ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // sna stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the eyes, one strives in the emptiness of the eyes.🔽If one strives in the emptiness of the ears, one strives in the emptiness of the ears.🔽If one strives in the emptiness of the nose, one strives in the emptiness of the nose.

original: lce stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lce stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the tongue, one strives in the emptiness of the tongue.

original: lus stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the body, one strives in the emptiness of the body.

original: yid stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the mind, one strives in the emptiness of the mind.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of form, one strives in the emptiness of form.

original: sgra stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽dri stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽ro stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgra stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // dri stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // ro stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of sound, one strives in the emptiness of sound.🔽If one strives in the emptiness of smell, one strives in the emptiness of smell.🔽If one strives in the emptiness of taste, one strives in the emptiness of taste.

original: reg stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: reg stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of touch, one strives in the emptiness of touch.

original: chos stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of dharmas, one strives in the emptiness of dharmas.

original: mig gi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the eye constituent, one strives in the emptiness of the eye constituent.

original: gzugs kyi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the form element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams @115b stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams @115b stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the eye consciousness element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: rnam ba'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽sgra'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam ba'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // sgra'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the form element, it is said one exerts oneself.🔽If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the sound element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽sna'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // sna'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the ear consciousness element, it is said one exerts oneself.🔽If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the nose element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: dri'i kham stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri'i kham stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the smell element, it is said one exerts oneself.🔽If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the nose consciousness element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: lce'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the tongue element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: ro'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ro'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the taste element, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of the tongue consciousness, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: lus kyi khams stong ba nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi khams stong ba nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of the body, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: reg gi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: reg gi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of touch, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of the body consciousness, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: yid kyi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽chos kyi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // chos kyi khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of the mind, it is said one exerts oneself.🔽If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of mental objects, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽sdug bsngal stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽kun 'byung ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // sdug bsngal stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // kun 'byung ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the element of the mental consciousness, it is said one exerts oneself.🔽If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of suffering, it is said one exerts oneself.🔽If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the arising of suffering, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: 'gog pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of the cessation of suffering, it is said one exerts oneself.

original: lam stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the path, one is said to strive.

original: ma rig pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of ignorance, one is said to strive.

original: 'du byed stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of volitional factors, one is said to strive.

original: rnam @116a *// par shes pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam @116a *// par shes pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of consciousness, one is said to strive.

original: ming dang gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of name and form, one is said to strive.

original: skye mched drug stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of the six sense spheres, one is said to strive.

original: reg pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of contact, one is said to strive.

original: tshor ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽sred pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // sred pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of feeling, one is said to strive.🔽If one strives in the emptiness of craving, one is said to strive.

original: len pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //🔽srid pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o // srid pa stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of grasping, one is said to strive.🔽If one strives in the emptiness of existence, one is said to strive.

original: skye ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one strives in the emptiness of birth, one is said to strive.

original: rga shi stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rga shi stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of old age and death, one is said to be exerting oneself.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of all phenomena, one is said to be exerting oneself.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang ji snyed ming du gdags su yod pa de dag thams cad stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang ji snyed ming du gdags su yod pa de dag thams cad stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: If one exerts oneself in the emptiness of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, however many there are, that can be designated by names, one is said to be exerting oneself.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rang bzhin stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe rang bzhin stong pa nyid la brtson na brtson zhes bya ste /
translated: if great bodhisattva beings, when they practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, exert themselves in the emptiness of essential nature, they are said to be exerting themselves.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu; de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu; de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag la brtson na brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, if great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom in this manner, they are said to be exerting themselves in these seven aspects of emptiness.

original: de stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed kyang brtson zhe'am /
analyzed: de stong pa nyid bdun po 'di dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed kyang brtson zhe'am /
translated: Although they apply themselves to the perfection of wisdom through these seven kinds of emptiness, they do not think, “I am applying myself.”

original: mi brtson zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: mi brtson zhes mi brjod de /
translated: “They are diligent in the perfection of wisdom through these seven kinds of emptiness, but they are not called ‘diligent’ or ‘not diligent.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / des gzugs brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / des gzugs brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi @116b brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽tshor ba brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi @116b brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // tshor ba brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: It is because they do not see form as ‘diligent’ or ‘not diligent.’

original: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽'du shes brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // 'du shes brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They do not see feeling as ‘diligent’ or ‘not diligent.’

original: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽'du byed brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // 'du byed brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They do not see perception as ‘diligent’ or ‘not diligent.’

original: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa brtson zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They do not see volitional factors as ‘diligent’ or ‘not diligent.’

original: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see consciousness as ‘diligent’ or ‘not diligent.’

original: gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: gzugs skye ba'i chos can nam /
translated: They do not see form as a dharma that arises or

original: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽tshor ba skye ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // tshor ba skye ba'i chos can nam /
translated: nor as something that has the nature of cessation.🔽He does not see feeling as something that has the nature of arising,

original: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽'du shes skye ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // 'du shes skye ba'i chos can nam /
translated: nor as something that has the nature of cessation.🔽He does not see perception as something that has the nature of arising,

original: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽'du byed skye ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // 'du byed skye ba'i chos can nam /
translated: nor as something that has the nature of cessation.🔽He does not see volitional factors as something that has the nature of arising,

original: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rnam par shes pa skye ba'i chos can nam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rnam par shes pa skye ba'i chos can nam /
translated: nor as something that has the nature of cessation.🔽He does not see consciousness as something that has the nature of arising,

original: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // gzugs kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
translated: nor as something that has the nature of cessation.🔽He does not see form as something that has the nature of being afflicted,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: nor as something that has the nature of being purified.

original: tshor ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
analyzed: tshor ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /
translated: He does not see feeling as something that has the nature of being afflicted,

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos can du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo; ;'du shes kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos can nam /

analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that they are diligent or not diligent with regard to the emptiness of emptiness.

analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la brtson zhes bya ba'am /

translated: They do not consider that they are diligent or not diligent with regard to the emptiness of the unlimited.🔽They do not consider that they are diligent or not diligent with regard to the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end.

original: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not consider that they are diligent or not diligent with regard to the emptiness of non-dispersal.

analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la brtson zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They do not consider that they are diligent or not diligent with regard to the emptiness of inherent existence.🔽They do not consider that they are diligent or not diligent with regard to the emptiness of all things.

analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la brtson zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la brtson zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: mi brtson zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /

translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rnam grangs de lta bus na /
analyzed: rnam grangs de lta bus na /
translated: for these reasons

original: chos thams cad 'du ba dang 'bral ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //

translated: it is said that great bodhisattva beings are ‘endeavouring in the transcendent perfection of wisdom’, because all things are neither conjoined nor disjoined, and because they are neither perceptible nor imperceptible.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sdud mi 'byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe stong pa nyid dang stong pa nyid du mi sdud mi 'byed de /
translated: when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom, they do not combine emptiness with emptiness, nor do they separate them.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no //
translated: They do not combine emptiness with the yoga of emptiness, nor do they separate them.

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang mtshan ma med par mi sdud mi 'byed de / mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no //

original: smon pa med pa dang smon pa med par mi sdud mi 'byed de /
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang smon pa med par mi sdud mi 'byed de /
translated: They do not combine aspirationlessness with aspirationlessness, nor do they separate them.

original: smon pa med pa'i rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i rnal 'byor dang yang ma yin no //
